column3: Slightly tend to NACK. If an attacker wants to waste some CPU-milliseconds, they can already achieve it way easier.

I don't think we care about making it ever so slightly faster in the presence of a mutated block as that is an exceptionally uncommon case (and one that results in the peer giving us the block being banned).\n\n@MarcoFalke  mutation is a type of invalidity that doesn't require the attacker make a pow valid block.
Alright I'll close to spare the other reviewers. Thanks, and on to other things.
